glosses: Initialism of sosialistinen neuvostotasavalta (“Soviet Socialist Republic”).
Abbreviation of Sosialististen neuvostotasavaltojen liitto (“the USSR”).

examples.text: No ei kai ne minua teurasta, / vaikken olekaan SN-seurasta.
examples.ref: 1983, Pauli "Juice" Leskinen (lyrics and music), “Eesti (On My Mind)”, in Boogieteorian alkeet peruskoulun ala-astetta varten, lyhyt oppimäärä, performed by Juice Leskinen Grand Slam
examples.english: Well, I doubt they'll slaughter me, / even though I'm not from the FSUS.

glosses: Short for Suomi–Neuvostoliitto-Seura (“Finland – Soviet Union Society”).
Initialism of Suomi–Neuvostoliitto-Seura (“Finland – Soviet Union Society”).

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

categories: Finnish terms derived from Old East Slavic

words.etymology_text: From Russian знать (znatʹ, “to know”), in first person singular знаю (znaju), from Old East Slavic знати (znati), from Proto-Slavic *znati.

glosses: shot glass, particularly one that doesn't widen at the top
snobbishness (state, quality or instance of being snobbish)

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

words.etymology_text: From snobba- + -illa. The former Swedish snobb, the latter a frequentative suffix.

categories: Finnish terms suffixed with -us (action or event)

glosses: snobbishness (state or quality of being snobbish)
Abbreviation of sentti (“cent, one hundredth of euro”).

words.etymology_text: From English snorkel, from German Schnorchel.
< Swedish snö (“snow”). Includes a slang suffix (compare spuge, tsyge)
